text: hi everyone podcasts here the internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time for a
review of the new Don Toliver record
lovesick this is the third full-length
album from Houston vocalist Mr Don
Toliver whose career has held a pretty
steady Limelight position ever since he
signed on with Travis Scott's Cactus
Jack label essentially building up a
sound that felt like an r b tinged
offshoot of Scott's own brand of
progressive psychedelic trap a few years
ago Toliver hit us with a pretty meager
debut that yes was one-dimensional but
still had a pretty distinct style and
sound to it the very next year he
dropped Life's a dawn which runtime wise
was a much larger project aesthetically
I think this record expanded tolliver's
sound too but the overall Vibe of this
thing was so low-key so washed out so
cloudy a great deal of it was a snooze
Fest almost none of the Bold Flavor he
rode in on through tracks like no idea
showed up so I went into lovesick hoping
to to hear a bit more of a pulse and I
will admit it is a bolder move with
features from future Bieber James Blake
kaliuchi's Toro imois as well as little
Dirk among others the production is
definitely more visceral and versatile
this time around too I think Toliver is
trying to shine more vocally on this
record as well pushing his range a bit
showcasing a wider variety of
inflections which ultimately is good I
like hearing the ambition but I think
his attempts at flying toward the sun
fall flat for the most part and for kind
of obvious reasons love sickness is a
pretty toothless piece of Psych trap
with some lazy guitars hanging in the
background not exactly the strongest
tone Setter for the album especially
with toliver's vocal mix and the bass
being so aggressive it overtakes
everything else in the song I suppose
the falsetto vocal harmonies and
mystical production on Let Her Go are
pretty nice but there's something kind
of off about the James Blake feature on
here the nuances get kind of lost in
this cluttered instrumental and then
there are some parts of it that feel
weirdly distant and other parts that
feel like they're miked super closely as
if I'm hearing I don't know an ASMR
recording it's presented in this really
inconsistent way that I don't think is
all that flattering to James's voice and
on top of it it doesn't exactly make for
a climactic finish either then we have
leave the club I believe the first time
I heard this track I said if I heard
this in a club I would leave and that's
still pretty much the case we have a
pretty choppy low budget beat on this
one soaked in very Lush synthesizers
tolivers versus our Meandering and don't
bring much punch meanwhile the hooks are
loaded with these ridiculous falsetto
leads that come across sillier than I
think he's intending them to the only
redeeming qualities of the track in my
opinion are the Dirk feature and the
pretty epic beat switch in the last leg
then why is the groove on for me so damn
awkward it actually kind of interrupts
tolivers and kaliuchi's ability to stir
up any real chemistry on here and why is
the singing on go down so freaking awful
especially around the mid midpoint to
where the autotune can't even save it
there are a few Cuts in the middle of
this track list that I think picked the
momentum up a little bit there's
honeymoon which has a slick and groovy
bass line over which Toliver sounds
really flirty funny charismatic as he
throws out imagery of an intense but
volatile love kind of getting Anderson
pack Vibes off of this one and in the
best way possible then there's private
Landing featuring Justin Bieber and
future which is a moody trap Banger
loaded with all of these low-key
eccentricities we have tolliver's left
field vocal inflections some droning
bass some Sinister Keys Future's
appearance is bold meanwhile Justin
Bieber's vocal runs on here are super
melodic and smooth even if the features
in production make up a lot of the
tracks appeal this is still one of the
stronger songs in toliver's catalog but
sadly the momentum this cup brings
doesn't last far into the second half of
lovesick there's slow motion which is a
sensual dance cup featuring whiz kid
which is for sure a highlight laced with
trippy effects and synthesizers that
sound like a slowed down version of an
80s Club hit meanwhile do it right is
another attempt at a slow jam but this
one wears out its welcome really quickly
with some really obnoxious and nasally
inflections on the chorus
and super messy production that sees the
drums keys and bass all syncing up into
these super flabby hits that are frumpy
and distorted and just doesn't really
convey the smoothness and Beauty the
song is clearly going for if I had with
Charlie Wilson slows things down even
more it's kind of a Spacey love Odyssey
which in concept is fine but vocally the
song has no real direction from Charlie
or Don himself like the tune of this
thing is weak as hell the chords are
just super back burner just very faint
it feels like everyone involved is just
trying to like fill the air in a really
awkward fashion just to make it seem
like something is happening which I
think Don does a better job job of on
company part three but not by much
thankfully this album hits us with one
more major major Banger before it bows
out with bus stop the cute and catchy
vocal samples from black streets I can't
get you out of my mind make for a really
nice interpolation but what really
steals the show on this cut is the
bumping production from Hit Boy d-pat uh
206 Derek the kicks on this track are
Relentless they just go go go go go go
it's like an Energizer Bunny type beat
which makes the much more atmospheric
and woozier beat switch on the second
half of the song feel that much better
especially when Brent faius comes
through with a really passionate
performance the downside of which is
that uh pretty handily he displays
himself as being a pretty Superior
vocally speaking to Don and
encouragement is an attempt at I suppose
a triumphant closer where Don throws out
a few corny bars like uh that what about
uh she only cries on her pill and on her
pillow yeah that's in the mix here but
again it is a feel-good moment where he
gives a nod to his success to Travis
Scott his girlfriend kaliucci's which is
cute seems like he's in a really good
place in a positive place on the end of
this record and that's great that's fine
Don is entitled to toast to his own
success at the end of a record that I
hope does well for him but ultimately I
just don't feel like that sense of
achievement is coming through in the
Artistry on the record because once more
I feel like Don toliver's production
choices are super inconsistent his
songwriting is often mid or just not
really there in terms of chops or
Direction his vocal performances and
Arrangements often leave something to be
desired and truth be told he's not the
strongest Lyricist either and finally
when there are great moments on this
record uh they often come by way of the
beat or the feature on the track being
so good so yeah I feel like he's not not
really advancing all that much and and
just not improving as as far as his his
craft at making albums I'm feeling a
light two decent five on this LP
transition have you given this album a
listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should I review
